text.p: “ Once we made songs to be sung – now we write poetry to be read… ”

ISBN 1 84158 152 6
£12 . 99
US$25 . 00
www . birlinn . co . uk

Gaelic poetry copyright © the Estate of Donald John MacDonald
English introduction and translations copyright © Bill Innes 1998

Book design by Bill Innes
Printed and bound by Bell & Bain Limited , Glasgow

Do mhaise , dùbailte gun cuir mi sìos i
Gu bheil nam shùilean a cruth cho dìomhain ; ( nad on tape )
Do chuachag lùthsail na lùban fìorghlan
’ S e sìos mud ghuaillean na chuailean chiatach .

Tha mi ’ n - diugh gu h - ànrach fuar
Anns a ’ chuaraidh fo gheàrd ,
M ’ fhuil a ’ tanachadh le dìth air on tape
’ S cion a ’ bhìdh air mo chnàmh .

[…]
Tune :
O nach àghmhor a - nis bhith fàgail ( 28 )
[…]

[…]
Is the sun - warmed isle of the thistled hills .
( 29 )
[…]

[…]
This poem greatly impressed the adjudicators who awarded it first prize at the Gaelic Society of London Mod in 1953 .
( 38 )
[…]

[…]
The best of carrageen to be plucked – ( 40 )
[…]
In the most miserable of hard times .
( 41 )

[…]
To his cousin , Morag Cumming , eldest daughter of Donald Macintyre the Paisley Bard and a fine interpreter of her father ’ s songs .
( 42 )
[…]

[…]
MacSween delivered as rent to them .
( 44 )
[…]

* A more accurate translation might be :
Bha ’ n smaointean geamnaidh sàr - ghlan saor bho bhuair ’ :
* * This verse was omitted from the ms , so the editor offers these lines for completeness
* The ms has the English spelling here - though not in the first chorus .

[…]
The Children of Uisne ’ s way reminding us ( 80 )
[…]

[…]
As did warriors of the Feinn in their cave – ( 84 )
[…]

A translation of Cherubino ’ s aria Voi the sapete from Mozart ’ s Marriage of Figaro . This was commissioned for the radio programme Obair Opera and sung by Mary Sandeman , who subsequently recorded it .

[…]
The metre is 17th century with irregular verse lengths .
( 89 )
[…]

[…]
After Donald MacDonald , South Lochboisdale , had sent Donald John some verses in his praise , he received this generous tribute from his fellow bard .
( 100 )
[…]

[…]
Greetings from me to the laird of Iarmain – ( 101 )
[…]

Gur tric mi nist a ’ cuimhneachadh
Nuair bha sinn cruinn ’ s sinn òg ,
Gun dragh , gun uaill , gun fhoill unnainn
Ach faoineis grinn gun ghò ;
’ S gur beag san uair a smaointich mi
Gu sgaoiltear sinn cho og
’ S gu fàgainn pàirt dhem chompanaich
Air àraich lom gun deò .
( 16 ) p . 60 : Gèideabhal and Hecla - See Notes 8 & 10 . Teach an Triubhais is usually known as Corodal and is the third highest of the South Uist bens .
( 23 ) p . 74 : Originally : A bha aig Dòmhnall na phàiste [That Donald had as a baby] .
( 25 ) p . 74 : Originally ’ S i a ’ tionndadh a tòine [Turning her back on me]

’ S mise rinn a ’ chearbaiche
Falbh air a ’ chùrs ’ ud -
Gun chuir e gu h - aimlisgeach

M ’ ainm feadh na dùthchadh :
’ S duiliche leam càch
A bhith ràdh air mo chùlaibh
G ’ eil cailleach anns an Iochdar
Toirt cìoch air a glùin dhomh !

( 29 ) p . 87 : The bard wrote grèite , which is given as grèidhte [prepared , dressed] in Dwelly . However , grèidheadh could mean ‘ sunning , warming ’ in South Uist as in bha e ga ghrèidheadh fhèin aig an teine [he was warming himself at the fire] .

Gus ’ n chrìochnaich am Bùidsear
An dùil bha nam blàth - chridh .
( 35 ) p . 130 : On tape the bard himself sang : Mar bhrùidean an fhàsaich [Like brutes of the wilderness] . However , the word brùideadh occurs in line 6 of the verse .
( 36 ) p . 132 : This line is as sung on the same tape . It makes better sense than the original in Sguaban Eòrna - ‘ Ach rinn Alba ris coibhneas ’ [But Scotland showed him kindness] .
( 38 ) p . 137 : The adjudicator wrote - “ A near classic undoubtedly… Remarkable scope of conception and perfection of execution… must be preserved . ”

Gu robh Handel ’ s Mantovàni ,
Bha Tchaikovsky ’ s Korsàkov ,
Strauss is Chopin agus Bhàgner
Air na clàir a bh ’ aig Bean Eòin .
( 57 ) p . 172 : This line is as sung by the bard on tape . In the ms , however , he was more diplomatic : ’ S thug e cunntais air na h - euchdan [He recounted all the deeds] .
( 59 ) p . 174 : The chorus and verses 4 & 6 plus the first quatrain of verse 5 ( shown here in italics ) were re - cycled , slightly modified , from an earlier love song .

Chan iongnadh ged bhithinn ,
Ged bhithinn , ged bhithinn ,
Chan iongnadh ged bhithinn
A tighinn oirr ’ a thòir :
Chan iongnadh ged bhithinn
A ghaoil , ga do shireadh ,
’ S do phògan cho milis
’ S tha mhil air an ròs .

Chruthaich Dia mi mar a b ’ àbhaist :
’ S e gum fàsainn bha na dhòchas -
Cha b ’ e bha na inntinn idir
Gu robh mise gu bhith chòrr ann :
Chruthaich e m ’ anam neo - bhàsmhor ,
Ged bha peacadh Adhaimh beò air ,

Ach bha Sàcramaid a ’ Bhaistidh
Dol a thaisbeanadh na glòir dhomh .

Air neo do dhìteadh le Crìosda
Do theine shìorraidh nach mùch

Gun seinn mi ’ n duan / tha m ’ inntinn suas ,
Mo ruinn gum fuaigh mi / còmhla iad
